# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/_emoji_codes.py
@source-hash: 86ed552fd9db55da
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:00:00Z

## Emoji Code Mapping Dictionary

A comprehensive emoji lookup dictionary containing 3,610 emoji mappings from string keys to Unicode emoji characters. This module serves as a reference/lookup table for emoji rendering in the Rich library.

### Primary Structure
- **EMOJI Dictionary (L1-3610)**: Single dictionary mapping human-readable emoji names to their Unicode representations
  - Keys: Snake_case emoji names (e.g., "face_with_tears_of_joy", "thumbs_up", "united_states")
  - Values: Unicode emoji characters (single or compound with ZWJ sequences)

### Emoji Categories Represented
- **Geographic**: Country flags (L8-341), regional indicators (L2786-2811)
- **People & Activities**: Facial expressions, hand gestures, professions, sports (scattered throughout)
- **Objects & Symbols**: Various objects, UI elements, mathematical symbols
- **Nature**: Animals, weather, plants, celestial bodies
- **Food & Drink**: Various food items and beverages
- **Transport**: Vehicles, traffic signs, transportation modes
- **Skin Tone Modifiers**: Fitzpatrick skin tone variants (L2781-2785)

### Unicode Complexity
- Simple single-codepoint emojis: Basic faces, symbols
- Compound sequences: Multi-codepoint emojis using Zero-Width Joiners (ZWJ)
- Flag emojis: Regional indicator symbol pairs (e.g., "ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸" for US flag)
- Skin tone variations: Base emoji + skin tone modifier sequences
- Complex sequences: Family compositions, profession variants by gender

### Alias System
The dictionary includes multiple aliases for the same emoji (e.g., L2814-2834 show "football"/"american_football", "car"/"red_car", "phone"/"telephone")

### Key Architectural Notes
- Read-only lookup table - no modification methods
- Memory-efficient single-level dictionary structure
- Compatible with emoji standards including newer Unicode additions
- Designed for fast O(1) emoji name-to-character resolution

This serves as the emoji engine for Rich's text rendering capabilities, enabling emoji insertion via readable names rather than Unicode codepoints.
